snippet: About two dozen supporters who have contributed as much as allowed to the mayoral campaign of the public advocate, Bill de Blasio, have donated more to defray debts from his 2009 race.
abstract: Public advocate Bill de Blasio is taking donations to defray 2009 campaign debts from people who already gave maximum permissible amount to his 2013 campaign for mayor, and state records show that in some cases donors have given to both campaigns on the same day; tactic is legal, but watchdog groups criticize practice, especially in city with one of strictest campaign finance systems in the nation.
lead_paragraph: About two dozen supporters who have contributed as much as allowed to the mayoral campaign of the public advocate, Bill de Blasio, have donated more to defray debts from his 2009 race.

headline.seo: De Blasio Donors Hit Maximum, but Keep Giving
headline.main: De Blasio Donors Hit Maximum, but Keep Giving
headline.print_headline: Donors Give To de Blasio Beyond a Limit
